name: Uplevel
title: Principal engineer
summary: Uplevel, a series-A startup hatched at Madrona Venture Labs, hired me to stand up a greenfield React SPA web app for its engineering  effectiveness dashboard. On the path to product/market fit, I have created two different greenfield SPAs to support the product.
contributions: Led front-end development of two different React SPA (create-react-app and vite) webapps delivering effectiveness dashboards for software engineering organizations, including Fortune 100 companies.

Developed a hackathon project that was integrated into the production app: a robust query parameters utility that enabled flexible sharing of UI state for customer data visibility and greater efficiency during QA cycles.
Led/anchored feature initiatives for the development team, serving as liaison to PMs; documenting and maintaining technical requirements; shepherding development calendar.
Worked closely with PMs and design to negotiate and document technical requirements.
Led front-end engineering efforts on error handling and monitoring.
Led front-end engineering efforts on i18n and l10n.

name: The Climate Corporation
title: Staff software developer
summary: As a staff engineer for The Climate Corporation’s Insights web team, I supported the desktop and webview UI with HTML5, CSS (SASS and css-modules) and React/Redux. I also Led the initiative to build the next iteration of our internal React component asset library.
contributions: Led UI development of React app to integrate digital farming diagnostic equipment with farm field mapping and CRUD operations.
Collaborated closely with UX design teams in California and Missouri to test and validate use cases.
Led project to refactor and improve internal React library for use by internal front-end development team with an eye towards extensibility and acessibility.
Mentored junior developers in front-end development via technical presentations and brown bag sessions.

name: Wetpaint
title: Front-end software developer
summary: I was hired by Wetpaint to supplement its growing development team supporting dynamic entertainment content for women aged 18-34.

name: Aptimus (Apollo Education Group)
title: Front-end software developer
summary: I was hired By Aptimus as the cornerstone of a growing front-end development team tasked with supporting the University of Phoenix marketing website (http://www.phoenix.edu), a high-traffic site that receives millions of page views every month. As Led UI developer, I create dynamic, data-driven templates and components utilized by the Apollo Group web content strategy team to build the UOPX website.
contributions: Led development of template UI for UOPX homepage, degree-program pages, course pages and continuing education mini-site (many of the site’s highest-visibility pages), as well as various extensible components
Collaborated closely with UX design teams in California and Missouri to test and validate use cases.
Spearheaded integration of Backbone MVC framework in codebase from research through implementation to standardize team Javascript coding efforts
Led key CSS refactoring efforts to reduce CSS load times and improve development efficiency
Mentored junior developers in Day (Adobe) CQ enterprise CMS development and Javascript
Initiated project to support responsive presentation for mobile devices via implementation of Twitter Bootstrap

name: Zillow.com
title: Front-end software developer
summary: I was recruited by Zillow.com to provide development expertise with regard to UI.
contributions: Developed UI for Zillow Professional Directory
Presented talk advocating for semantic HTML development during Zillow Developer Presentation
Contributed core Web 2.0 concepts such as standards-based development; code validation; and separation of structure, presentation and behavior into Zillow codebase.

name: Seismic Interactive & Design
title: Web designer/developer
summary: I was hired to guide development of company into full-service interactive agency, implement processes for small- and large-scale web project development and provide advanced level of design/development expertise with regard to UI and programming. I implemented all phases of site development; mentored co-workers in web development skills; administrated Linux-based dedicated server and in-house Internet connectivity infrastructure on a day-to-day operational basis; and provided Internet technologies consulting for 20+ employees of strategic-management affiliate company.
contributions: Created proprietary WAVE<sup>™</sup> client needs evaluation, which was implemented as standard procedure in project exploratory process.
Managed transfer of client websites to in-house dedicated server, allowing company to generate new revenue stream and significantly reduce third-party website hosting expenses.
Headed technical development of ADDY award-winning projects: Green Bay Chamber of Commerce “Shine” interactive CD (2003), Green Bay Chamber of Commerce “A Place To Shine” website (2006).
Integrated core Web 2.0 concepts such as standards-based development; code validation; and separation of structure, presentation and behavior into company web development process.

name: Pulse Communications
title: Web designer/developer
summary: I was hired to guide development of company into full-service interactive agency, implement processes for small- and large-scale web project development and provide advanced level of design/development expertise with regard to UI and programming. I implemented all phases of site development; mentored co-workers in web development skills; administrated Linux-based dedicated server and in-house Internet connectivity infrastructure on a day-to-day operational basis; and provided Internet technologies consulting for 20+ employees of strategic-management affiliate company.
contributions: Developed interactive tradeshow kiosk, increasing client’s product sales by 625%. (25 systems vs. 4 systems in previous year)
Proposed, built and deployed company intranet to improve internal communication and project coordination.
